content:
InputManager Class

In this Article

Manages all the input systems in Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF).

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class InputManager : System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject
  • InputManager

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()
,
CheckAccess()
,
Dispatcher
,
VerifyAccess()

Remarks

The InputManager class is responsible for coordinating all of the input systems in WPF.

A filter is any code that listens to PreProcessInput or PostProcessInput. Filters can modify the input staging area.

A monitor is any code that listens to PreNotifyInput or PostNotifyInput. Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.

The InputManager controls the input staging area. The input staging area processes input into Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) events.

Input is processed in WPF in the follow stages:

  1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the PreProcessInput event.

  2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the PreNotifyInput event.

  3. The WPF input event or events are raised.

  4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the PostNotifyInput event.

  5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the PostProcessInput event.

Properties summary

Current

Gets the InputManager associated with the current thread.
InputProviders

Gets a collection of InputProviders registered with the InputManager.
IsInMenuMode

Gets a value that indicates whether this ComponentDispatcher is in menu mode.
MostRecentInputDevice

Gets a value that represents the input device associated with the most recent input event.
PrimaryKeyboardDevice

Gets the primary keyboard device.
PrimaryMouseDevice

Gets the primary mouse device.

Methods summary

PopMenuMode(PresentationSource)

Called by components to leave menu mode.
ProcessInput(InputEventArgs)

Processes the specified input synchronously.
PushMenuMode(PresentationSource)

Called by components to enter menu mode.

Events summary

EnterMenuMode

Occurs when a control enters menu mode by calling the stem.Windows.Input.InputManager.PushMenuMode* method.
HitTestInvalidatedAsync

Occurs when the result of a hit-test may have changed.
LeaveMenuMode

Occurs when a control leaves menu mode by calling the stem.Windows.Input.InputManager.PopMenuMode* method.
PostNotifyInput

Occurs after the PreNotifyInput handlers have finished processing the input and the corresponding Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) events have been raised.
PostProcessInput

Occurs after the PreNotifyInput handlers have finished processing the input.
PreNotifyInput

Occurs when the PreProcessInput handlers have finished processing the input, if the input was not canceled.
PreProcessInput

Occurs when the InputManager starts to process the input item.

Properties

  • Current

    Gets the InputManager associated with the current thread.

    public static System.Windows.Input.InputManager Current { get; }

    Property Value

    • InputManager

      The input manager.

    Remarks

    This class will not be available in Internet zone.

  • InputProviders

    Gets a collection of InputProviders registered with the InputManager.

    public System.Collections.ICollection InputProviders { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection

      The collection of input provides.

  • IsInMenuMode

    Gets a value that indicates whether this ComponentDispatcher is in menu mode.

    public bool IsInMenuMode { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this ComponentDispatcher is in menu mode; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The IsInMenuMode property returns true if any menus are open, and it returns false if no menus are open.

  • MostRecentInputDevice

    Gets a value that represents the input device associated with the most recent input event.

    public System.Windows.Input.InputDevice MostRecentInputDevice { get; }

    Property Value

    • InputDevice

      The input device.

  • PrimaryKeyboardDevice

    Gets the primary keyboard device.

    public System.Windows.Input.KeyboardDevice PrimaryKeyboardDevice { get; }

    Property Value

    • KeyboardDevice

      The keyboard device.

  • PrimaryMouseDevice

    Gets the primary mouse device.

    public System.Windows.Input.MouseDevice PrimaryMouseDevice { get; }

    Property Value

    • MouseDevice

      The mouse device.

Methods

  • PopMenuMode(PresentationSource)

    Called by components to leave menu mode.

    public void PopMenuMode (System.Windows.PresentationSource menuSite);

    Parameters

    • menuSite
      PresentationSource

      The menu to leave.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      menuSite is null.

    Remarks

    A component calls this method to leave the input manager’s menu mode. The menuSite releases privileged access to window messages.

    Calling this method causes the internal count of open menus to decrement and sets the IsInMenuMode property to false, if this is the last menu to close.

  • ProcessInput(InputEventArgs)

    Processes the specified input synchronously.

    public bool ProcessInput (System.Windows.Input.InputEventArgs input);

    Parameters

    • input
      InputEventArgs

      The input to process.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if all input events were handled; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      input is null.

    Remarks

    A filter is any code that listens to PreProcessInput or PostProcessInput. Filters can modify the input staging area.

    A monitor is any code that listens to PreNotifyInput or PostNotifyInput. Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.

    The specified input is processed by all the filters and monitors and is finally dispatched to the appropriate element as an input event.

    Input is processed in WPF in the follow stages:

    1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the PreProcessInput event.

    2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the PreNotifyInput event.

    3. The WPF input event or events are raised.

    4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the PostNotifyInput event.

    5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the PostProcessInput event.

  • PushMenuMode(PresentationSource)

    Called by components to enter menu mode.

    public void PushMenuMode (System.Windows.PresentationSource menuSite);

    Parameters

    • menuSite
      PresentationSource

      The menu to enter.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      menuSite is null.

    Remarks

    A component calls this method to enter the input manager’s menu mode. The menuSite gets privileged access to window messages. Calling this method causes the internal count of open menus to increment and sets the IsInMenuMode property to true, if this is the first menu to open.

Events

  • EnterMenuMode

    Occurs when a control enters menu mode by calling the stem.Windows.Input.InputManager.PushMenuMode* method.

    public event EventHandler EnterMenuMode;

    Remarks

    Components register delegates with this event to respond to a control entering the input manager’s menu mode.

  • HitTestInvalidatedAsync

    Occurs when the result of a hit-test may have changed.

    public event EventHandler HitTestInvalidatedAsync;
  • LeaveMenuMode

    Occurs when a control leaves menu mode by calling the stem.Windows.Input.InputManager.PopMenuMode* method.

    public event EventHandler LeaveMenuMode;

    Remarks

    Components register delegates with this event to respond to a control leaving the input manager’s menu mode.

  • PostNotifyInput

    Occurs after the PreNotifyInput handlers have finished processing the input and the corresponding Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) events have been raised.

    public event System.Windows.Input.NotifyInputEventHandler PostNotifyInput;

    Remarks

    A monitor is any code that listens to PreNotifyInput or PostNotifyInput. Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.

    The handlers attached to PostNotifyInput are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.

    Input is processed in WPF in the follow stages:

    1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the PreProcessInput event.

    2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the PreNotifyInput event.

    3. The WPF input event or events are raised.

    4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the PostNotifyInput event.

    5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the PostProcessInput event.

  • PostProcessInput

    Occurs after the PreNotifyInput handlers have finished processing the input.

    public event System.Windows.Input.ProcessInputEventHandler PostProcessInput;

    Remarks

    A filter is any code that listens to PreProcessInput or PostProcessInput. Filters can modify the input staging area.

    The handlers attached to PostProcessInput are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.

    Input is processed in WPF in the follow stages:

    1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the PreProcessInput event.

    2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the PreNotifyInput event.

    3. The WPF input event or events are raised.

    4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the PostNotifyInput event.

    5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the PostProcessInput event.

  • PreNotifyInput

    Occurs when the PreProcessInput handlers have finished processing the input, if the input was not canceled.

    public event System.Windows.Input.NotifyInputEventHandler PreNotifyInput;

    Remarks

    A monitor is any code that listens to PreNotifyInput or PostNotifyInput. Monitors cannot modify the input staging area.

    The handlers attached to PreNotifyInput are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.

    Input is processed in WPF in the follow stages:

    1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the PreProcessInput event.

    2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the PreNotifyInput event.

    3. The WPF input event or events are raised.

    4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the PostNotifyInput event.

    5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the PostProcessInput event.

  • PreProcessInput

    Occurs when the InputManager starts to process the input item.

    public event System.Windows.Input.PreProcessInputEventHandler PreProcessInput;

    Remarks

    A filter is any code that listens to PreProcessInput or PostProcessInput. Filters can modify the input staging area.

    The handlers attached to PreProcessInput are invoked in reverse order so that handlers added by the users are invoked before handlers in the system.

    Calling Cancel on the PreProcessInputEventArgs passed to the PreProcessInputEventHandler will cancel the processing of the input.

    Input is processed in WPF in the follow stages:

    1. Pre-process stage. The input manager raises the PreProcessInput event.

    2. Pre-notify stage. The input manager raises the PreNotifyInput event.

    3. The WPF input event or events are raised.

    4. Post-notify stage. The input manager raises the PostNotifyInput event.

    5. Post-process stage. The input manager raises the PostProcessInput event.
